intro: Sebaea fourcadei, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with thick, waxy leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Sebaea fourcadei is also appreciated in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
